poem:
Title: Sing, App, against the Silent Screes

For 7.6 million clothed in constant drone,
A haven whispers in the ether's mist.
The buzzing, ring, lone caterwauling tone,
By app's sweet serenade, could be dismissed.
In silence' chaos, seeks the balm, unknown,
To mend the symphony that tinnitus kissed.
Deaf to the dusk, but for the sirens' song,
Yet digital relief might hold the gong.
